title: What if the Bourbons took Louisiana in 1774 and flee to the colony in 1789? - Quora

response.answer_text: A good question . Such a question I made several times in connection with the nazi attack on the Netherlands. The whole Dutch government of that time and the Royals fled to England. It seems they never made any effort to go from England to one of their colonial territories. Between 1940 and December 1941 Indonesia, Dutch New Guinea, Dutch Guyana and the Dutch Antilles were their free territories. Perhaps that was one of the reasons that made Mr. Soekarno later collaborate with the Japanese.
It would be like the situation with Brazil and the Portuguese, though quite possibly it would just get conquered by revolutionary France.
